tweets.text: Opponents of plans for an incinerator near #Witham will have their case heard in the high court later. The @EnvAgency has approved the site at Rivenhall but residents say they're worried about the health implications, and want the chimney to be higher #Essex https://t.co/sbOw5gAYAM

It's a tricky balance between ensuring adequate capacity for base flows whilst retaining important woody debris in the channel. Careful and selective thinning happening today thanks to @Boreal_Trees @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/V6rVOiBy4K

Today, Creating Climate Resilient places starts at 9:30am BST with Hugh Ellis, Rebecca Pow, Karen Thomas, Sir James Bevan, Jacky Huson, Tony Juniper and more.  We'll be sharing live quotes from the day on the hashtag #FloodandCoast2020.  @EnvAgency https://t.co/W4YAfWMiGW

* Hebden Bridge FAS *

tweets.text: It's almost time! Have you registered for this years #WaterlineSummit? https://t.co/X1HVPfrL1Q

You‚Äôre on our radar! https://t.co/jmYmUt7SIn

Carrying out checks across #Devon today with @EnvAgency to ensure compliance with the #ScrapMetal Dealers Act & disrupt the trade in #stolen #metal from #HeritageSites, #Farms & #Infrastructure. If you're offered #Cash4Scrap this is illegal & should be reported to @EnvAgency. https://t.co/bH7ywe7od2

tweets.text:
Wet wipes & sanitary products caused this sewer blockage in #Newark #Notts. It could have caused sewer flooding for nearby homes & damage to the #environment!

Always bin such products & only flush the 3 Ps - paper, pee & poo - down the loo!
https://t.co/nZMqVh9N3d #Unblocktober https://t.co/Qm2D87WqTm

There is a lot of detail that sits behind the @EnvAgencyNW  flood scheme in #Kendal #DidYouKnow we have submitted documents to satisfy our pre-planning conditions for Phase 1  - these are explained on the @TheFloodHub at https://t.co/EymWqMP6tV https://t.co/xzJQ4F93Sg
At last @EnvAgency prepares to get rid of concrete blockage on Ipswich cycle path. https://t.co/u8bEoBdLXe

Keynote speakers for the science-policy conference on UK climate change adaptation (13-14 Oct) are @EmmaHowardBoyd of @EnvAgency, Baroness Brown of @theCCCuk adaptation committee and @DefraGovUK SoS Rt Hon George Eustice MP. https://t.co/jcrblAFNXK
#UKClimateAdapt

tweets.text: @janetmanning1 @dhedges_gower @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile @HoggIndependent @Sport_England Where I live, we had a natural grass field with two football pitches with a cricket square between them and three tennis/netball courts which were stripped ready to become a car park. Now we just have a pay-to-play 3G pitch, and a much smaller natural grass football pitch.

tweets.text: @janetmanning1 @dhedges_gower @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile @HoggIndependent @Sport_England Hi Janet, yes, it is. I've been researching this for many years now, mostly sleepless nights, etc, wondering how to stop our govt building more and more. I consider this to be a public health scandal on a par with BSE, thalidomide, asbestos, DuPont and the infected blood scandals https://t.co/22muC5K7Ue

@Against_3G @dhedges_gower @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile This thread is utterly depressing, are taxpayers really paying for 3g pitches that are marketed as low maintenance, have cancer risks,  water pollution risks, and a future outlook of thousands of tonnes of plastic waste that can't be recycled? @HoggIndependent @Sport_England

tweets.text:
@dhedges_gower @janetmanning1 @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile https://t.co/VG8najaWtY
Tyre dust in air pollution.

Can you imagine how much more a footballer is breathing in when playing on 120 tonnes of tyre dust and crumb?

Sport should be fun and keep you fit not kill you!

Really glad that ECHA are banning it. https://t.co/7ZPx4MpEct

urls.title: Air pollution from tyres up to 1,000 worse than from exhaust, claims study
urls.description: Air pollution from car tyres can be up to 1,000 times worse than from an exhaust, research from Emissions Analytics has suggested. Non-exhaust emissions (NEE) are expected to rise from 7.4% today to 10% of all UK PM2.5‚Ä¶

tweets.text: @dhedges_gower @janetmanning1 @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile Yes... I know you've seen this David, but I'll post it again. ...   the waste at end of use. https://t.co/ToXNncZrAS
@Against_3G @janetmanning1 @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile Absolutely crazy or as we say these days...... normal! ü§ëü§¢üòßü•±ü§´ü§•ü§≠ü§î

This is the #Keighley Aire Valley site where @bradfordmdc @SHinchcliffe approved an #incinerator and @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA are minded to issue an operating permit. Temperature inversions are seen regularly meaning the emissions would be trapped under it. üò∑üè≠üî• https://t.co/S0qi6350k8

@dhedges_gower @janetmanning1 @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile Yes, it's an absolute waste of our money. Councils (from council tax), clubs, pay about ¬£300 and the FF/FA pays the rest, via Sport England but ultimately from our income tax.
But in the end, our world is paying for it as the pollution from the waste at end of use lasts for ever.
@Against_3G @janetmanning1 @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile Only a million? Imagine how many #natural pitches that would maintain? üôÑ

@janetmanning1 @dhedges_gower @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile FA, FF, Sport England, RFU, etc, all know that ECHA will be banning the use of toxic #RubberCrumb infill in 3G artificial football/sports pitches.
Infill will have to be removed and replaced with natural infill. They should have told @bromleyfc before they spent almost ¬£1million. https://t.co/6dh4a3EFvM

@dhedges_gower @Against_3G Unbelievable! It might make players more comfortable but the South East is water stressed, where is the water coming from for @bromleyfc irrigation @thameswater? Where is the diffuse carcinogenic pollution going @EnvAgencySE? @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile

Day 62

The next environmental ticking time bomb will be toxic #PFAS and #PFOS chemicals polluting UK waters.
#DarkWaters 

 @EnvAgency @DefraWater @GeorgeMonbiot @carolecadwalla @BBCNews @Channel4News @jonsnowC4 @EnvAgencyYNE

Rogue traders using social media to con you into parting with your waste cheaply could fly-tip it and land you with a criminal conviction. Before hiring someone to remove your waste, check their credentials online https://t.co/zGcHi9qEA2 https://t.co/gRg0F3ejff https://t.co/7TMYEsKEZw

@TheAdventurer7 @EnvAgencySE @WSCCNews Hi there. The police are now involved in this, as the local team found evidence inside the waste that connect it to an address. We were told by the police not to remove the waste until the investigation was photographed and completed, hence the delay in removal. Thank you.
